title: Epic 00: Architecture Rework (Retrospective)
description:
Based on full retrospective analysis of current codebase. Addresses all architectural decisions we'd do differently if starting over. This epic should be prioritized BEFORE continuing feature work.

## 1. Real Data Pipeline First (replace procedural generation)
- Run Python data pipeline (tools/heightmap, tools/provinces, tools/cities) to completion
- Generate real heightmaps from SRTM data
- Real province boundaries from AWMC shapefiles
- Real city positions from Pleiades database
- Generate 4096 binary chunks (4KB each) with real Mediterranean terrain
- Load into Supabase from day one
- Retire proceduralChunk.ts once real data is flowing

## 2. BatchedMesh Instead of Per-Chunk Meshes
- Replace individual THREE.Mesh per chunk with THREE.BatchedMesh
- Group all LOD0 chunks into one BatchedMesh, LOD1 into another, etc.
- Target: 4 draw calls total for terrain instead of 100-200
- Handle geometry buffer limits and dynamic add/remove
- Retrofit chunkLoader.ts to manage BatchedMesh instances

## 3. Engine/World Scene Graph Manager
- Extract monolithic main.ts (300 lines) into an Engine class
- Subsystem registry pattern: each system implements init(), update(dt), dispose()
- Main.ts becomes ~30 lines of bootstrap
- Systems: terrain, water, provinces, cities, trees, agents, UI, input
- Enables clean hot-reloading, testing, and adding new systems

## 4. Remove Premature Quality Auto-Scaler
- Strip qualityManager.ts (242 lines) with 4 presets and FPS-based auto-switching
- Replace with one hardcoded quality setting
- Re-add auto-scaler only when real performance bottlenecks are identified
- Simplifies every system that currently has setQuality() methods

## 5. IndexedDB Mesh Caching
- Add idb-keyval mesh caching before further worker pool polish
- Cache mesh geometry buffers keyed by (cx, cy, lod)
- Instant terrain on page reload instead of full regeneration
- Invalidation strategy for when chunk data changes

## 6. ECS-Style Shared Data Architecture
- Replace per-renderer data models (city, tree, province, water each with own model)
- Shared world-state store or lightweight ECS
- Single spatial index serving all systems
- One data layer to connect when Supabase backend comes online
- Eliminates 720-line cityDatabase.ts with hardcoded arrays

## 7. Data Pipeline to Completion Before More Rendering
- Complete all tools/ Python scripts (currently stubs)
- Generate real binary chunks and validate renderer against real data
- Ensures zero rework when switching from procedural to real data
close_reason: All items verified implemented in codebase

title: Visual quality crisis: post-processing ruins scene, black bars, severe stuttering
description:
## Spec-vs-Code Comparison (Section 21: Post-Processing Pipeline)

Every single post-processing value deviates from the spec. This is not fine-tuning — the code ignores the spec entirely.

### Bloom
| Parameter | SPEC | CODE | Off by |
|-----------|------|------|--------|
| Strength | 0.15 | 0.35 | 2.3x too strong |
| Radius | 0.4 | 0.6 | 1.5x too wide |
| Threshold | 0.85 | 0.58 | Way too low — blooms mid-tones |
| Strategic zoom | disabled | always on | Missing height guard |

### Vignette
| Parameter | SPEC | CODE | Off by |
|-----------|------|------|--------|
| Intensity | 0.25 | 0.45 | 1.8x too strong |
| Smoothness | 0.8 | 0.65 | Harder edges = dark bars |

### Color Grading
| Parameter | SPEC | CODE | Off by |
|-----------|------|------|--------|
| Saturation | 0.85 (fixed) | 0.75-1.0 (dynamic) | Drops to 0.75 at far zoom = gray world |
| Shadow tint | (30,25,50) cool purple | not implemented | Missing |
| Highlight tint | (255,240,210) warm golden | not implemented | Missing |
| Warmth | +0.08 | gain/lift hack | Different method |
| Contrast | 1.05 | gamma hack | Different method |

### Parchment Overlay
| Parameter | SPEC | CODE | Off by |
|-----------|------|------|--------|
| Max opacity | 0.15 at h≥5000 | 0.25 at h≥5000 | 1.67x too opaque |
| Implementation | 512x512 noise TEXTURE | 2x 4-octave FBM PER PIXEL | Insane GPU cost for nothing |

### Tilt-Shift
| Parameter | SPEC | CODE |
|-----------|------|------|
| Type | BokehPass | 9-tap gaussian (25+ samples/pixel) |
| Blur amount | 2.0 detail / 0.5 tactical / 0 regional+ | 2.0 * linear factor |
| Cost spec | ~0.5ms | Likely 3-5ms+ (25 texture samples/px) |

### Province Renderer (Black Bars)
- Spec: "Province-ID 0 rendered with desaturated colors and fog overlay (baked vertex colors)"
- Code: province renderer paints Province-ID 0 as vec3(0.0) = PURE BLACK with 8% opacity
- Combined with vignette (0.45) + map edge fade = near-black edges

### Performance Budget
- Spec total post-processing: ~2ms
- Actual: bloom + 25-tap tilt-shift + 2x 4-octave FBM + vignette = likely 5-10ms

## Files to Fix
- postProcessing.ts: every single value
- provinceRenderer.ts:305: barbarian black
close_reason: All post-processing values aligned to spec §21. Province renderer barbarian black removed. Build clean.

description: viewportSystem computes view range as Math.ceil(camY/100) producing a 37x37 rect at default height. But ChunkLoader ignores this and uses its own spiral radius logic (loadRadius=6). Per ECS.md, viewportSystem output should drive chunkLoadSystem decisions. The viewport rect must be the authoritative source for which chunks to load/unload.
close_reason: viewportSystem now exports getViewRange(), chunkLoadSystem passes it to ChunkLoader.update(), ChunkLoader dynamically adapts loadRadius/unloadRadius from viewport. Change detection includes viewRange so zoom changes trigger load/unload. viewRange capped 2-20, unload hysteresis +4 chunks.

title: Implement legion patrol waypoint system
BUG: Codex Batch 1 - TypeScript Errors & Test Failures
description:
Codex delivered unstaged changes across 12 files + 10 new files.
The code does NOT compile and has 5 test failures.

## TypeScript Errors (2)

### 1. logger.ts:28 - TS6138: unused private field 'category'
Logger class declares `private readonly category` but never reads it (only passes category to createLogger in constructor).
Fix: remove the field or prefix with underscore.

### 2. chunkCodec.test.ts:90 - TS2345: ArrayBufferLike vs ArrayBuffer
`decodeChunkHeader(view.buffer)` - DataView.buffer returns ArrayBufferLike which includes SharedArrayBuffer. Our decodeChunkHeader expects ArrayBuffer.
Fix: cast `view.buffer as ArrayBuffer` or change function signature.

## Test Failures (5)

### 3. config.test.ts - 3 tests fail: validateAndLoadConfig returns valid=false for defaults
Root cause: `isPositiveIntLike()` is called on ALL NUMBER_FIELDS including nearClip (0.1) which is NOT an integer. The validator wrongly requires nearClip/farClip to be integers.
Fix: nearClip/farClip and frameBudgetMs should use isPositiveNumber, not isPositiveIntLike.
Affected tests: 'loads default runtime config', 'validates geometry relationships', 'accepts valid overrides'.

### 4. math.test.ts - tileToIndex clamping test wrong expectation
Test expects tileToIndex(32, 31) === 31 but gets 1023.
tileToIndex(32,31): x=32 clamped to 31, y=31 clamped to 31 → 31*32+31 = 1023.
The test expectation is wrong: it expected x=32 to clamp and y=31 to stay, giving index 31 (row 0 col 31). But y=31 is valid and stays 31.
Fix: correct the test expectation to 1023.

### 5. supabase.test.ts - vi.mock hoisting error
Mock factory references `createClientMock` variable which is not yet initialized due to vi.mock hoisting.
Fix: use vi.hoisted() or move mock setup.

## Design/Architecture Issues

### 6. Unnecessary aliases bloating math.ts
chunkToTile() is literally `return chunkToWorld()`. tileIndex() is literally `return tileToIndex()`. chunkDistance() is literally `return distance()`. Three pointless wrapper functions that add API surface with zero value.

### 7. tileToIndex behavior silently changed
Original tileToIndex was a pure math function (localY * CHUNK_SIZE + localX). Codex added clamping + Math.floor, changing the contract. Any caller passing already-validated values now pays unnecessary clamping overhead.

### 8. Logger class wraps createLogger redundantly
The new Logger class just wraps the existing createLogger function factory. It adds a class for no reason - createLogger already returns the exact same debug/info/warn/error interface.

### 9. main.ts imports non-existent getNetworkStatus at module level
main.ts references getNetworkStatus() which is defined later in the same file as a local function, but also imports from './startup' and './core/qualityManager'. These modules exist but the overall structure is fragile - startup.ts has an import from './supabase' which causes side effects at module load.

### 10. startup.ts bad indentation
checkViewport() has broken indentation at line 61-67: the early return block is indented wrong (closing brace at column 0 inside a function body).

### 11. supabase.ts references process.env in browser code
`process.env.VITE_SUPABASE_URL` - process.env doesn't exist in browser. Vite only exposes import.meta.env. This will throw ReferenceError at runtime.

### 12. chunkCodec.ts - unnecessary API surface
Exposed CHUNK_MAGIC, CHUNK_VERSION, CHUNK_HEADER_SIZE as exports + new decodeChunkHeader/encodeChunkHeader functions. These are internal implementation details that should stay private. The public API is encodeChunk/decodeChunk.

## Summary
- 2 TS compile errors
- 5 test failures (3 suites)
- 6 design issues
- Code was NOT committed to a branch, left as unstaged changes on main
- Violates COORDINATION.md: should work on codex/epic-XX branch, never on main
close_reason: All 12 issues fixed, merged via PR #2
